creator.name: Bosch, Johannes van den
creator.his_func:
J. van den Bosch (1780-1844) began his career in the army of the Batavian Republic (1797). In 1827 King Willem I asked him to be commissioner-general to improve the administrative control from the Netherlands over the West Indian possessions. He stayed in the West Indies from December 1827 until August 1828. He was responsible for the "Reglement op het beleid der Regeering van de Nederlandsche West-Indische bezittingen" (July 1828). Among other things, this regulation tried to improve the position of slaves.

Later that year Van den Bosch was appointed Governor-General in the Netherlands East Indies. From 1834 until 1839 he was Minister of Colonial Affairs.
